citations.narrative:
A plastic bin containing monkey biscuits was insanitary. The lid of the container was coated in a thin layer of dust and
grime. The inside of the container had a thin layer of caking with a layer of biscuit dust approximately 4 inches deep.
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health
and well-being of the animals.
Food receptacles must be located as to minimize any risk of contamination by excreta and pests and must be kept clean
and must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks. To be corrected by July 15, 2023.

Two primary enclosures are in need of maintenance and/or repair:
• The back fence of the petting zoo enclosure, housing two pigs, two sheep, and eight goats, has an area of exposed,
pointy, twist selvage along the bottom edge. A section of this chain link fence, approximately 12 feet in length, is backed
by wooden planks. Inside the enclosure, the twist selvage curves inward, away from the planks, creating an edge of
numerous pointy protrusions approximately 10 to 15 inches above the ground.
• In the coatimundi enclosure, there is a metal patch, approximately 9”X12”, that is attached to the metal bars of the
enclosure by wire. Some of the wires are not fully twisted and leave sharp, pointy extensions facing inward.
Protruding sharp, jagged edges may cause injury to the animals as they pass by.
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury and to contain the animals. To be corrected by July 25, 2023.

A metal feeder, located in the rear, right section of the petting zoo enclosure, was insanitary. The tray located at the top of
the feeder was covered in a thin layer of wet, smelly hay. The wet hay was soaked in a urine like liquid and had flies
swarming around it.
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health
and well-being of the animals.
Food receptacles shall be placed so as to minimize contamination and shall be kept clean and sanitary at all times. To be
corrected by July 15, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.82(d) 
   
Feeding. 
A plastic bin containing monkey biscuits was insanitary. The lid of the container was coated in a thin layer of dust and 
grime. The inside of the container had a thin layer of caking with a layer of biscuit dust approximately 4 inches deep. 
 
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health 
and well-being of the animals. 
 
Food receptacles must be located as to minimize any risk of contamination by excreta and pests and must be kept clean 
and must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks. To be corrected by July 15, 2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Two primary enclosures are in need of maintenance and/or repair: 
 
• The back fence of the petting zoo enclosure, housing two pigs, two sheep, and eight goats, has an area of exposed, 
pointy, twist selvage along the bottom edge. A section of this chain link fence, approximately 12 feet in length, is backed 
by wooden planks. Inside the enclosure, the twist selvage curves inward, away from the planks, creating an edge of 
numerous pointy protrusions approximately 10 to 15 inches above the ground. 
• In the coatimundi enclosure, there is a metal patch, approximately 9”X12”, that is attached to the metal bars of the 
enclosure by wire. Some of the wires are not fully twisted and leave sharp, pointy extensions facing inward.  
 
Protruding sharp, jagged edges may cause injury to the animals as they pass by. 
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from 
injury and to contain the animals. To be corrected by July 25, 2023. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding.

A metal feeder, located in the rear, right section of the petting zoo enclosure, was insanitary. The tray located at the top of 
the feeder was covered in a thin layer of wet, smelly hay. The wet hay was soaked in a urine like liquid and had flies 
swarming around it. 
 
Improperly cleaned food receptacles can cause contamination of food, which may have a negative impact on the health 
and well-being of the animals. 
 
Food receptacles shall be placed so as to minimize contamination and shall be kept clean and sanitary at all times. To be 
corrected by July 15, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
